comment.author: 41133925@N02
comment._content: This is a Halberstadt CLII. A two seat fighter which entered service with the German Air Service in 1917. Most of the damage is concentrated around the crosses on the wings,tailand fuselage. This may mean that most of the damage was caused by souvenir hunters. A common practice.

comment.author: 82596826@N03
comment._content:
The IWM caption for the photo above states the Halberstadt Cl.II was brought down in the British sector near Faverolles, France on the 29th May 1918

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/7585321018/]
